alfredsnippet.snippet:
Jacques Barzun, Science: the glorious entertainment, p.288

"The scientific quest does not discover reality, but is frequently rebuffed by it. This is a spur to finding, by fresh leaps of imagination, hypotheses that no experimental facts will deny, and then to organize these imaginings among themselves according to the rules of the game. Science at this point shows signs of abdicating its primacy and of climbing down to the lower status of, not art, but an art."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - The Scientific Quest is Frequently Rebuffed By Reality
